snippet: Large-scale online courses, hailed as a way to democratize higher education, have so far been plagued by very high attrition rates.
abstract: Large-scale online courses, hailed as a way to democratize higher education, have so far been plagued by very high attrition rates; University of Pennsylvania study of million users of courses found only about half of those who registered for a course ever viewed a lecture, and only about 4 percent completed courses.
lead_paragraph: Large-scale online courses, hailed as a way to democratize higher education, have so far been plagued by very high attrition rates.

headline.main: After Setbacks, Online Courses Are Rethought
headline.print_headline: After Setbacks, Online Courses Are Rethought
